label: 御簾
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: [Passim] The blinds and stand curtains were in sweet-flag colors, deeper toward the bottom, with superimposed images...." Blinds (misu) did not ordinarily come in color combinations, nor were they decorated with paintings. Perhaps the author [of Eiga monogatari] had in mind the curtains that were hung from the lintels behind the blinds (kabeshiro, "parition drapes")(p720). [壁代]"
